HediffDef.label: Stunted
HediffDef.description: Stunted metroids are metroids that are 'locked' into their current form, and prevented from growing into further stages. This is generally used for taking advantage of the unique properties a metroid stage may have, such as the ease of care for a Bantee, or the profitability of a Gamma. However, stunting can also occur as a health defect in the wild.\n\nA stunted metroid may have a significant increase in value - or vice versa - depending on the metroid stage.

HediffDef.label: Stunted
HediffDef.description: A Metroid that is incapable of evolving into further forms. While this is often done intentionally to 'lock' a metroid into a desired lifestage, stunting may also occur as a genetic defect. Stunted metroids have a decreased appetite (as they no longer need to grow), but eventual long-term genetic complications significantly decrease their overall life expectancy.\n\nThis metroid's value has decreased signiicantly, due to being locked out of more useful potential mutations.

The very life energy of this being has been drained. A being becomes progressively less energetic and aware as more life is drained. Luckily, death is only guaranteed by full draining, and plenty of rest will reverse the effects. \nBodies that have been drained of life turn into stone-colored husks, with their faces permanently frozen in the last seconds before death.
